snippet: Responding to a vow taken by nearly all Republicans in Congress not to back any tax increase, Senate Democrats want to allow all the tax cuts to expire, then pass a middle-class cut.
abstract: Senate Democrats are proposing a plan that would circumvent a Republican pledge not to vote for any tax increase whatsoever; virtually every Republican in Congress has taken the pledge, pushed by Grover Norquist's Americans for Tax Reform, and it is seen by members of both parties as a serious impediment to any compromise; the Democrats' plan, which entails allowing the Bush-era tax cuts to expire, only to vote on a tax cut for the middle class thereafter, illustrates the lengths to which they will go to include new revenues in the budget.
lead_paragraph: Responding to a vow taken by nearly all Republicans in Congress not to back any tax increase, Senate Democrats want to allow all the tax cuts to expire, then pass a middle-class cut.

headline.seo: Senate Democrats Propose Letting All Tax Cuts Expire
headline.main: Democrats Propose Plan to Sidestep Anti-Tax Pledge
headline.print_headline: At Fiscal Cliff, Anti-Tax Vow Gets New Look
